H0.text: Metabolic pathway is a series of biochemical reactions by which an organism converts a given reactant to a specific end product.

H1.text: Internal pathway is the term for a series of biochemical reactions by which an organism converts a given reactant to a specific end product.

H2.text: Direct pathway is the term for a series of biochemical reactions by which an organism converts a given reactant to a specific end product.

H3.text: Hydrogen pathway is a series of biochemical reactions by which an organism converts a given reactant to a specific end product.

A4.text: In biochemistry, a metabolic pathway is a linked series of chemical reactions occurring within a cell.

A5.text: In most cases of a metabolic pathway, the product of one enzyme acts as the substrate for the next.
